Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
Here is shell script:
```bash
#!/bin/sh
hex=$(printf "$1" | xxd -ps)
echo ${#1}$hex
```

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: so just start with the string you want it to be converted

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
```
$ ./dataconvert.sh "22"
23232
$ ./dataconvert.sh "Hello world"
1148656c6c6f20776f726c64
```

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Sorry, one mistake

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: the length

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: just a sec

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
Here is final script:
```bash
#!/bin/sh
hex=$(printf "$1" | xxd -ps)
len=$(printf "%.4x" ${#1} | tac -rs ..)
echo $len$hex
```

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @siu - Chainmakers so this will convert any string to what you need

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
```
$./dataconvert.sh "22"
02003232
$ ./dataconvert.sh "Hello world"
0B0048656c6c6f20776f726c64
```

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content:
```#! /bin/bash

gpg=$(gpg -aer Chainmakers)
count=$(printf "%.4x" ${#gpg} | tac -rs .. | echo "$(tr -d '\n')")
#count=$(echo -n $gpg | wc -c | xxd -b -p)
bits=$(echo -e $gpg | xxd -b -p | tr -d '\n')
echo $count$bits
cd ~/komodo/src
hex=$(echo $(./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE oraclesdata 322dd0c55601f3e459bb78f2a5dcf202d4de851fd6e20629b4c489284712076f $count$bits | jq '.hex' ))
rawtx=$(echo "${hex:1: -1}")
./komodo-cli -ac_name=KMDICE sendrawtransaction $rawtx
```

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you can broadcast multiple oraclesdata in a single block from same publisher if you subscribe to it multiple times

Author: Alright#0419
Content: for example, chat dapp scripts will register an oracle then subscribe to it 10 times by default

Author: Alright#0419
Content: meaning user can send 10 messages(txs) per block

Content: hah... interesting... didnt know that subscribing more times would allow for faster publications
